p: Cumulatively, 392 adults and 51 nymphs were captured with pheromone traps in the four areas from April to late June–early July ( Table 1). The mean number of daily captures for each area is reported in Figure 1. Overall, mean daily captures ranged from 0.01 to 0.58, with a peak occurring in late April, concurrently with an unusual increase in the average temperature (18.6 °C). Nymphs appeared in all areas in June. Significant differences in mean daily captures of adults between sampling dates were recorded by one-way ANOVA in Area 2 (F (6, 35) = 7.168, p < 0.0001) and Area 3 (F (6, 35) = 2.672, p = 0.031). No significant differences were found in Area 1 (F (5, 30) = 1.371, p = 0.263) and Area 4 (F (7, 40) = 1.044, p = 0.417) ( Figure 1).
